Reviews.Title: “Budget Stay in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: scoredonu
Reviews.Content: What this hotel clearly is not is a resort. In fact, it is a motel. Yes the rooms don't have a lot of furniture. Yes the beds are not the best.. Yes the hot tub was tiny. Yes you hear people moving above on the upper floor. Yes the tv had analog cable. However, the rooms are clean, the service was good and the location was centralized. Not to mention it is a budget hotel. ONE SUGGESTION the rooms allow too much light into the room making it difficult to sleep. Invest in curtains or better blinds. Stayed here through a Group On special which translated out to two nights for 140 bucks or so. So the 4 out of 5 rating has everything to do with price. Save money on accommodations means more money to spend doing wine tasting and eating out.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, welcoming, low-cost option”
Reviews.Author: FrankHutch
Reviews.Content: A surprising alternative to the many over-priced accomodations in Napa. A perfect place for a family, with an attentive and welcoming staff. This is a motel, but surpassed typical motel standards. Everything is nicely painted, clean, and ship shape looking. Housekeeping staff did a great job. We stayed for three nights, and in many motels this would be a long time. At the Chablis Inn we did not have any regrets and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You won't trip over the furniture...”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn S
Reviews.Content: ..because there is not much in the way of furniture in these rooms. Seriously, very sparse room -- bed, two night stands, small desk and chair, that's it. A cabinet holds the TV, which is an older model that has been around so long the lettering on the remote has started to fade. Lamps on the night stands do not give off much light, so the room is dark when the shutters are closed, which you must do to have privacy. Management has made some attempt to update and renovate the rooms, but the budget must have been small, because some things were updated, such as the bathroom sink and counter, but then again, the doors and trim throughout are chipped and peeled. We stayed here for the Groupon deal we purchased, but will not return.

Reviews.Title: “great value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Kathi B
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we are in Napa visiting my brother. The room had a "bar" type area with a small sink, counter and fridge, no microwave in our room. Bath area is small, but does have a bathbtub, not just a shower. We basically just sleep here and spend time in between going to wineries, San Fran., and other attractions...so it is a real value, compared to other hotels that charge 3X this much. If you have to have a 5 star hotel, this is not the place, it just depends on how much you are there. The beds are fine, rooms is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tulipslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is "cute", clean, and the staff are very nice. It's conveniently located near Trader Joe's, Target, coffee shops, and Hwy 29. We got a good deal to stay at Chablis Inn but probably will not stay there at regular price because of the noise. The hotel is on Solano Ave and we can hear the traffic from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Overall”
Reviews.Author: svtim
Reviews.Content: The Chablis Inn is a decent little place. Any hotel review in Napa requires you keep your perspective. Napa is one of those places where $300+ a night rooms are common. My room was about $100 (Motel 6, next door, was about $20 less). The room was small, clean, with a mini fridge and microwave. Everything worked. Beds average for comfort. Dog friendly at $25 per dog per night; empty lot on side of hotel to walk them. One of the best dog parks in California, Alston Park, is a 5 minute car ride away. Starbucks just across the street. Hot tub not used but looked very clean. On the downside, you could hear creaking with every step of the person in the room above. Old non-flat panel tv with limited channels. Room heater a bit noisy. Convenient but busy location. Would stay here again. Booking note: While waiting to check in I overheard part of a conversation regarding some kind of problem with the room/reservation with another guest. The management was responding by telling the guest they couldn't do anything about the issue since they had booked thru a third party. The "you didn't pay us, you paid them" line. I see this more and more these days with hotels, airlines, etc. It seems to be a technique to encourage people to book directly with the business. I am not saying the Chablis Inn is a bad guy here; I don't know the specifcs. I am just pointing out the general issue of how one books travel and how it affects you if there is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomendations!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie L
Reviews.Content: I recently spent several nights at the Chablis Inn. It was a wonderful experience!! My room was just lovely! The people working there are so friendly and helpful! If you are planning a trip to, or are passing through, Napa, California I suggest you stay at this hotel. You will not be disappointed!!! It is close to shopping, wineries, and great restaurants! Look forward to staying there, again, on my next trip to Napa, California!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest lodging and helpful staff! Cheap too!”
Reviews.Author: RiggsyRodrigues
Reviews.Content: Great spaceous rooms, clean and comfortable, not fancy please dont expect detailled service and decor but it perfectly serves its purpose! Has proper parking at the hotel (IMPORTANT) Will return if a visit to the Napa valley and vicinity is on my schedule again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: Kriggleman
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very Cozy! Comfortable bed and pillows, quiet room, warm heater, very spacious! I was very impressed with the hotels location. Lots of shopping right across the street, within miles of the beautiful, artistic Yountville area! I will defanilty stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: DonJHughes
Reviews.Content: With the wide variety of lodging establishments located throughout the Napa Valley, this was the first time I've ever stayed in the area (even though I am originally from the Bay Area and lived in San Francisco & San Rafael). My girlfriend and I decide on this place as this was part of a special for http://LivingSocial.com. She purchased me a package that included a 2-night stay for two complete with a complimentary bottle of red wine and a FREE tasting at Silenus Vineyards winery. For Napa, at $125, this is a great deal and we took full advantage of this amazing offer. As this review is focused mainly on the hotel, I will give you my full experience in the time I was here. We arrive on a Friday afternoon around 4:15pm as we checked into our room. We were both very impressed with the cleanliness of the room as well as how everything was laid out. As a nice added feature, there was a mini-refrigerator as well as wet bar, coffee maker (w/complimentary coffee & hot cocoa) an iron/ironing board, hairdryer, and TV armoire complete with about 20 channels on the TV. There was also a study area and the counter tops in the wet bar area and bathroom were of a nice granite which really made this little place look quite classy. In addition, the showers produced consistent hot water and the heater/air conditioner was up to par as well. I would have to say one of the only dislikes are that the beds are a little bit on the firm side. I guess I am spoiled considering I sleep on a queen size pillowtop at home but I almost had to always sleep on my back during my 2-night stay (even though I am mainly a side sleeper). One other minor complaint that my girlfriend had was that the wi-fi internet was a tad bit on the sluggish side (which was the primary reason for deducting a star on this place). Overall, this is a great location and what really sold us on this hotel was that it was in close proximity to everything; 1 block from Starbucks as well as the freeway & shopping; 3 blocks from Highway 29 and just a hop, skip, and a jump from Target & Whole Foods. We will definitely consider coming here again when we stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for pet-friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: Went for concert near by at Uptown theater. Couldn't have been happier for cute place, good size room for us (a couple) with our friend in neighboring queen bed, and two dogs. Very well-equipped and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms & affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Sierra K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there twice for a yoga workshop I was teaching in Napa. I will reserve again for the next workshop in May 2012. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. It's centrally located close to Whole Foods and all the great sites Napa offers. The grounds aren't super fancy however they do offer a pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: kim t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis Inn last month and it was exactly what we needed - conveniently located, clean and reasonably priced. The new owners have appointed it nicely, without going over the top and passing on the cost to the guest. Spend your money in Napa's fabulous wineries and restaurants and not on an outrageously expensive room! We'll be back to the Chablis. Because my mother won't let us stay with her. (I had to get that dig in.)

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Basic”
Reviews.Author: QuinnA
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute. Our first several choices in Napa valley were already full. The location isn't bad. The tile in our bathroom was broken in places and the jetted tub wasn't what we expected especially after paying for the upgrade. I guess the most fitting word for the Chablis Inn that comes to mind is serviceable.

Reviews.Title: “a place to sleep and that's it”
Reviews.Author: easy2bkeysey
Reviews.Content: We booked here last minute for $ 125/night because no other hotel was under $300. The photos online were way more generous than the actual hotel room. We could hear every move the people above us made when walking in their room, the toilet seat was cracked and the room's door had such a big space between the bottom of the door and the ground, you could hear the traffic very loud all night long. This was a place to sleep while enjoying Napa Valley, and that was it. Would not recommend it to others nor would we stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and cute, but a little loud.”
Reviews.Author: Steven U
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a few days before a wedding in the area. Great little spot, perfect location. The room and bathrooms were very clean. There was a little pool and jacuzzi, the latter of which I cleaned out myself before we went in (lots of flies), but it was great afterwards. My one big complaint is Solano Avenue is very busy in the mornings and our room was one doorway from the street. We had to wear the earplugs to sleep. If you're fine with this, no biggie, but if you don't do earplugs, I'd shy away from the property. But for the money, location and convenience, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lodging”
Reviews.Author: dredford
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, friendly place to stay while in Napa. Great buy as well. Little touches mean a lot. Fluffy towels, larger than usual sized shampoo/lotion. I would return if I could have a room away from the street. Quiet street but still noise of vehicles could be easily heard in rooms 1, 2, 3 on first level. Maybe upstairs in a far away corner. We spent three nights in room 2. By the 3rd night vehicle noises began to grate.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced gem in expensive area”
Reviews.Author: Kay N
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to find an inn in Napa that was reasonably priced and filled with amenities. The cost was half of other properties in the area, and the room was great: large, comfortable, and quiet. Although motel-style, the inn has a nice pool area and outdoor seating gazebo. Front desk staff helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Celeste2070
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a pretty standard stay at the Chablis since it just appears to be a standard road-side motor inn. I was pleasantly surprised at the great hospitality, unusually large room size, and pretty decent matress. But more than anything, this hotel is immaculate. They have literally the cleanest hot tub and pool I've ever seen in an outdoor pool area at any hotel I've ever stayed at in America (one can't compare America to Japan or Singapore for cleanliness). The rooms are nicely renovated, though I would say the showers are pretty much what you'd expwct for a 2/3 star hotel (some new shower heads would go a long way, but these are at least useable and water-efficient). As expected of most properties of this type, walls are thin and noise is easily heard bit from above and from the outside. The neighborhood is quiet though, and the road isn't too busy so it's not a major issue. Bring your bike as there is a great bike trail that runs adjacent to the property.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for spending time in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: erf
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our choice of the Chablis Inn. It was convenient to a mall with a Trader Joes and Whole Foods. We spent the week with Hugh Carpenters "Camp Napa" which is a wonderful experience of hands on cooking, and wine tasting. Hugh is a wonderful cook and has written many cookbooks . He lives in Napa and know all the most wonderful places.

Reviews.Title: “Spend money on good wine, save dollars on lodging”
Reviews.Author: LoveSun2010
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this small motor court property right off of hwy 29 in Napa. Clean, conveniently located to a high end market, Starbucks, and a shipping co., this is a nice option for anyone who is visiting wine country and doesn't mind a no frills motel.

Reviews.Title: “classy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nd2trvmore
Reviews.Content: well appointed and very comfortable. great location. chris at the front desk was very helpful as was the night guy who's name i failed to notice. i'll recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: 24theroadoflife
Reviews.Content: Clean, utilitarian and basic. Nice staff. Affordable. But if you're looking for a place where you can sit outside with a bottle of wine you've just picked up at a winery, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for visiting wineries”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick531
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, but it was perfect for visiting the wineries right around the area. The room itself was very nice and roomy, and it was right across the street from a few places to eat (burger ace, fish taco place, and pizza place) and a small supermarket. It was perfect for what we wanted at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to big national chains”
Reviews.Author: MorrisMinors2011
Reviews.Content: I particularly like to seek out the smaller independent hotels instead of the big greedy national chains especially Ramada, and have stayed at the Chablis several times when visiting Napa. The location is convenient to downtown as well as the surrounding wineries, the rooms are quiet, clean and decently appointed and a great overall value. The staff is helpful and the bed was wonderful. Frankly, the Chablis is my choice for quick Napa weekends every time!

Reviews.Title: “Chablis Hotel in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: archie c
Reviews.Content: Perfect little place to spend your time in Napa Valley. The rooms are clean and affordable. The hotel is in a perfect location to visit Napa old town and to make trips up into the valley. But the best feature of this hotel is the clerk behind the desk. Not only friendly and curtious, but goes beyond the call of duty to make sure you know the best places to see, where to eat and what is the best deals in the area. Big bang for the buck here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Chablis Inn”
Reviews.Author: DanaB636
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Chablis Inn in Napa when we went to see a concert at the Mondavi Winery. When we arrived after the concert, the parking lot was full and I was sure that this would mean the room would be noisy. Wrong. I never heard a thing. The room was quiet and comfortable and really clean! The bed was big and cozy and the linen was fresh and had the nicest scent. In the morning, I made coffee that was in the room, took a hot bath in the jet tub while my boyfriend stayed in bed and watched a movie. We stayed until check out time. The freeway is so close, we hopped right on and got on our way home. It was really a nice place and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: tobyz
Reviews.Content: This is a motel. We stayed in a second-floor room (queen/full bed) for four nights. The room was large, with a kitchen-like sink and small refrigerator across from the bathroom. Everything was clean and well kept. There is complimentary coffee and a coffee-maker. Staff is friendly and helpful. Very close to a shopping center with Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and Target, which we found convenient. Also, the motel is a short drive from downtown Napa and right off the turn-off for Rte 29, the main route for the wineries. Would stay there again if we return to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: DGF2011
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay at Chablis Inn and the man working at reception (did not catch his name) was v. helpful in recommending local activities. Would be rated as excellent if some form of breakfast was included. However, there is a great deli over the road in the strip mall to fill up in the AM.

Reviews.Title: “the glass is definitely half full at the chablis”
Reviews.Author: DaynaZeitlin
Reviews.Content: A quiant spot located on the outskirts of downtown napa, a bit too far to walk for the average person. Service was warm and hospitable. Pool area could use a little more warmth, but certainly nice to have. All in all, a great spot for those looking to save money for wine!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, thanks!”
Reviews.Author: BG G
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, convenient. All the staff we met were extremely helpful, friendly, kind. James raises customer service to an art form!

Reviews.Title: “A $60 motel for $198!”
Reviews.Author: NeilHW
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of ex-motels that have been updated (mainly the Joie de Vivre group) and liked them. The Chablis Inn, however, is a $60 motel anywhere other than Napa. Here, it is $190! Old interiors, WiFi that doesn't work unless you stand out in the car park, a tiny pool (filled to brimming by a hen party when we were there), dirty pillows, no water pressure, small rooms, noisy, right next to a busy road, nowhere to relax. Basically nothing but a 70's style motel. Stay somewhere else for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: TRex99
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, bed was fairly comfortable. Plenty of hot water. Quite decent for what it is--a place to crash after long days in wine country. If you're looking for amenities this isn't it. Reasonably close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ecze
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, but I liked the hotel. It was clean and neat. This is a nice hotel for short term visit to Napa or SF.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: yo007
Reviews.Content: Room is good sized, clean and has a mini fridge along with a mini sink and counter. I found this to be the best location for my needs, Starbucks across the street along with a grocery store and pizza joint. Target is a few blocks away for those items you may have forgotten. Easy on and off highway 29, and quick trips to the vineyards. Check in was easy and fast, we received a doggie treat bag, and saw two other families with dogs check in while we were in the office. Unlike other dog friendly places we've stayed (and paid more) the grounds showed no visible signs of 4 legged guests. Bath towels are probably the thickest I have used in a hotel, very nice. Bathroom was very clean. Only one negative, the bed shows signs of wear, big sag in the middle of the bed. Looks like it's time for an update! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: mrpaulus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with friends. Check-in was hassle free; the staff tried to answer all questions. I made use of the lobby computer with free Internet; it works fine. I took a quick dip in the small pool; it was OK but was a bit small and the water had a some leaves and bugs (outdoor pool). Bathroom and bedsheets were clean; nothing negative to report about the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Wine Tasting! I will always stay at Chablis Inn.”
Reviews.Author: kclovestravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Chablis Inn at least 3 times over the past 6 years. Each time I've had a great experience. It has always been clean and neat. It is a motel, so it not grand, but it is a good, safe place to stay. I was with 4 other friends, so we weren' t looking for a cute B&B - we wanted a place that was close to a lot and was a good deal for the money. It has an excellent location to get to all of the wineries and restaurants. There is a grocery store with a fabulous deli and Starbucks in close proximity to each other (just a minute's walk away), and we would split the group up - some would go get the breakfast, and others would go get sandwiches, etc. for our picnic during the day, and off we went all day. I highly recommend the Chablis Inn!

Reviews.Title: “good value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: X-NYr
Reviews.Content: Chablis Inn is well-located in Napa although not downtown. The room was standard motel but perfectly adequate for staying one or two nights and reasonably priced. The front desk clerk was very helpful and knowledgable. He suggested the excellent and convenient Alston Park for a nearby walk, and the well-stocked grocery store across the street for breakfast. (No breakfast included at Chablis.) Parking is free and easy, the price is right, and this provides a good starting point for exploring Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inexpensive stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler49
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, clean. inexpensive hotel/motel in Napa to spend 2 days of wine tasting with our son and his girlfriend. I chose this motel based on TA reviews and the price and we were not disappointed. The location was great, in the northern section of Napa and just off the main highway. We had an end room and were a little worried that street noise would be bothersome but it was not. There was a small gazebo with a table and seating and we had snacks and wine each evening. For wine tasting, it is all wonderful but do not miss Sterling, in Calistoga. It is a little more than some of the others but by far the best winery we went to. (There are some discounts on the web.) You take a cable car up to the winery (it may not be as worth it on a rainy or foggy day.) They greet you when you first get off with the first of the wines, point you on the self-guided tour and offer 2 more tastings along the tour. You end in the hospitality room with 2 more tastings. We enjoyed all of the wineries but this one was extra special. We also a great meal on Bistro Don Giovanni, just off the highway on the way to Yountville, about 5 miles (or so) from Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great vaule,great location”
Reviews.Author: chefsPGBrowns
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice,this last weekend was last moment needed a room, called and they had a room and it was at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Wine and 4 girlfriends”
Reviews.Author: michaelkeough
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Napa on June 14th and the trip was amazing. The Chablis is the perfect place for people who want to spend time in Wine Country because it is clean and affordable. Very comfortable beds and just clean. We would come back from a day of tasting wine and get our suits on and jump into the hot tub. The staff was very nice. The area is nice because across the street is a gormet grocery store and a shipping store. We shipped all of our wine and olive oil from that location and they were very affordable. Everything in walking distance. Wine country just 15 min. away. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Low price, great service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: 3931Brad
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel the night before a trip up Napa Valley based mainly on price and Trip Advisor reviews. What a great choice it was! There is a hot tub and small pool in addition to the spacious clean rooms and friendly staff. The night concierge recommended the morning concierge named James regarding wine tasting stops. James is a wealth of knowledge! He recommended several great stops including Hagafen Cellars which ended up being our favorite place. I'm planning on ordering a case of Hagafen Cabernet for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: vicodin25mg
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Chablis Inn for about three nights of my road trip to California. The Motel is reasonably priced and offers very clean rooms and bathrooms. It's very close to shopping centers, grocery stores and gas stations. It's about 10 minutes from downtown Napa and 20 minutes from the beautiful St. Helena. I personally recommend it for many other locations in the area are way more expensive and maybe are not as much convenient. Oh, by the way..the front desk staff is super nice and will help you planning your trip or your visit of the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: hillcresthog
Reviews.Content: Very handly location for touring the wine country. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Coast National Park, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “A gem in Napa for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: MsAudubon
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, I selected this spot for a last minute visit to Napa. The rooms are large, spotless, and well-appointed with all the conveniences. It was of higher quality in every way than one would expect in its price range. It is convenient to the main road to all points in the Valley, yet quiet. Across the street is a small shopping center for picking up food to prepare in room or get that morning coffee. My only complaint echoes that of a previous reviewer. No curtains on the window, just blinds, means light leakage. So sensitive sleepers be prepared with eye coverings.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed with the customer service from Larry and the room.”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlilly1953
Reviews.Content: We rented a house in Napa but the key in the lock box did not work. We got in at 1PM and after trying the key and emergency phone numbers to no avail we went looking for another hotel (preferably cheap). I thought this place was going to be awful but I was extremely impressed with the room - don't judge a book by it's cover. We got to the hotel at 3:30AM and had to wake up the desk clerk, Larry. He was so friendly and helpful to us - it helped make this bad situation just a little better. The room was great, a frig and hair dryer, granite counter tops, beds were awesome. Thank you Chablis Inn for taking us in and making us feel welcome! You rock!!

Reviews.Title: “A suprise on checkout!”
Reviews.Author: kaybo141
Reviews.Content: We spent one Saturday night there with a small dog, and, thanks to Larry, the desk man, were booked into the King spa room! It was very well appointed and we were thrilled to find a separate spa room. I went right to the desk and told the manager what a great room we had! The price was $139 and a $10 dog fee for a total of $156 or so. The next morning, at checkout, a different clerk told us the price was $15 more than quoted and our total bill was $179 - all this from $139 quote. The money wasn't the point. They should have been up front about the total price. I paid anyway with no hassle but felt a little duped. But we did love the room and will stay again but get the fine print at check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: gemelos3883
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice place to stay in Napa for the weekend that accepted pets, and was reasonably priced. I found the Chablis Inn online and read the other reviews of this hotel in Tripadvisor. Upon arriving James was super friendly and helpful. We were disappointed that the hot tub had been turned off but James told us he would tell the owner and see what he could do. (the next night it had been turned back on so we could enjoy it!) Yes, it was a little noisy but it is very clean, modern, and convenient. There is that little shopping center across the street that even has a Starbucks for you coffee in the morning. I would stay here again even if I did not have my pet with me.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located close to downtown Napa and the Wine Country.”
Reviews.Author: sactourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis Inn two nights with our bicycle club. The rooms were reasonably priced, clean, the spa was on, hot, and felt wonderful after a day of cycling around the Napa Valley. There is a shopping center across the street that has a very nice bike shop, restaurants, and a great grocery store that has hot food to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BronM41
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, but looks like it has had a recent spruce up. The room was spacious for the price & clean, the beds comfortable & the shower hot. The young lady who checked us in looked dead on her feet, but was still friendly & very helpful regarding places to eat (her breakfast recommendation was gold). It is not a pretty area, being in town & something at the rear (maybe the motorway) was a bit noisy early in the evening, but if you have a few hard core days wine tasting as we did, you have no trouble getting to sleep! For the cheap price, it was most certainly value for money, especially if all you are looking for is somewhere to shower & sleep, which is what we wanted. It is straightforward to get to the wineries from here & a reasonably priced cab ride to some of the downtown bars & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: JimmyBob1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend a few days in Napa Valley for our 1st anniversary. However, we were on a budget and couldn't afford the more expensive hotels in the area. We were recommended this hotel by the Yountville Tourist Center and we received a great rate, even on New Years Eve! The rooms are spacious , there's a nice little wet bar with a fridge. A small desk with a chair. The bathrooms are spacious and clean as well. Even though it was pretty cold this time of year, we enjoyed the jacuzzi that is located on the property. Driving to Yountville, it really accessible and quick. This hotel is also across the street from a nice little shopping area, with a good sized grocery store. We didn't get to do all the things we wanted to in Napa Valley, so we will definitely stay here when we visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, service and value”
Reviews.Author: oldvine
Reviews.Content: We recently moved to Yountville, and we celebrated Thanksgiving in our new home. The house is not big enough to accommodate our family of 15 (plus one dog) overnight so we chose the Chablis Inn to be the home away from home for nine members of the family.. From start to finish this was a terrific choice. The manager, Donna, was extremely professional, helpful and competent. Donna facilitated the reservations , including our special needs; and she made the check-in and payment process simple for us and our family. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well maintained. The family was complimentary of the accommodations, the staff and the location. They all agreed that future visits will definitely include the Chablis Inn. It should be noted that in addition to the great service, the Chablis Inn is a great value. Considering the costs of other hotels within the Valley we were pleased as to the value our dollar purchased here. We highly recommend the Chablis Inn, and our family looks forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Dpvid
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, it's a motel, and you will need a car to visit tourist attractions. But it is excellent value for the overpriced Napa Valley. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Unlike other more expensive places we stayed at, the room smelled nice. We stayed two nights and did not notice any noise problems, but then it was off season. The woman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “crush weekend”
Reviews.Author: filomina
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Chblis Inn. Lovely as ever (esp after the remodeling)--affordable, clean, and close to all the wineries and restaurants. We loved the little hot tub--great after a long day of walking and wine tasting. We will definitely return again and again! There is some street noise on the weekdays, but manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an inexpensive place to...”
Reviews.Author: ksoconnor
Reviews.Content: Great value for an inexpensive place to stay in Napa. The room was very clean and just what we needed. The staff was polite and helpful but you can't beat the advice and direction you get from a B&B. Really close to the highway so perfect to head out for a day of wine tasting. Would recommend asking for a room far from the road as it was a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “chablis inn is special”
Reviews.Author: nancyo2080
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the outskirits of Napa Valley. It is close to the wineries and you can there from either the Silvarado Trail and 29. This is the 3rd time we have stayed there and it won't be my last visit to the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: BobbieSacramento
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this charming inn that was both affordable and perfectly situated in beautiful Napa Valley. The wineries are just minutes away with world class restaurants that beckon any taste bud. We stayed in the room that included a king size bed, jacuzzi for two, and mini refrigerator to cool your favorite white wine. We highly recommend this inn for anyone looking for quality and affordability.

Reviews.Title: “decent stay in beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: dace12
Reviews.Content: The hotel/motel is great for the price and like most other guests have said, don't come expecting a nice hotel but it is definitely better than a motel 6. The only thing I would recommend for the staff is to use fabric softener for their towels, that would have made this stay more pleasurable. Bring your own toiletries so you have something at your standards, but the ones in the room aren't awful just in case you forget. That is is! Last minute trip and a busy weekend left us with few options but this was better than expected so I'd stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Friendly and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: habsace
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by Napa Tourism based on our hotel budget of $60 to $100. Our room was spacious and clean. The front staff are friendly and very helpful. The pool area is private and enjoyable to relax around after a day of wine tasting. The hotel is centrally located to the heart of the Napa Valley. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and we would return again in a heart beat. While visiting the Napa Valley we would recommend an afternoon on the Napa Valley Wine train. Definitely a highlight of our 4 days here.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: MRJPM
Reviews.Content: Lost our reservation (later found out they'd miskeyed the day; oops they said). Room spartan but for the price in Napa what you would expect. Sleep - interrupted after two hours because of a bedbug attack. I was so bitten that it required a doctor visit within 36 hours and a course of steroids. They moved us to another room in the middle of the night. At checkout the next morning - "Sorry you had such a bad night".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for the money, clean, nice pool, friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: matthias9000
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 days at the Chablis Inn in Napa: -Friendly staff from check-in to check-out -clean room with down comforters, nice little fridge, mini kitchenette the bed was a bit bouncy but nice for a change... (I have the hard kind at home...) -apparently very dog friendly even though we didn't have one -nice clean pool and hot tub!! Jaaaaaa! -Internet working super fast, even at the furthest away locations, able to stream netflix w/o hickups -the best smelling face and body soaps (two different kinds that i both liked) -Great price. If you are looking for a Luxury Motel, this is not for you but if you are trying to spend a few nights in a decent, clean Motel with your people, this is the place... Matthias Mederer San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveller34
Reviews.Content: Very pet friendly with doggie plush on counter and dog calendar in the lobby. Larry was quite friendly and helpful at the desk; made checking in a pleasure. Complimentary computer with internet access in lobby allowed me to checkin for my flight (didn't want to lug the laptop for just one non-business night). There are train tracks which run direclty behind the hotel; fortunately while I was there, there weren't any horns blasting at 1am but that could pose a challenge. Can't say much for the mattress comfort but my back was okay the next day. Mini-Fridge and extra counter & sink were unexpected perks. Eat at Fume Bistro (a few blocks north on the other side of Hwy 29)-delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Budget, dog friendly motel”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel since we needed to stay in Napa for one night (most have a 2 night requirement on weekends) and they accept pets - easier then shipping him to the kennel for the weekend. The property is very clean, the staff friendly. It was obviously a member of a motel chain recently. I will say the decor does not match the photo on their webpage. Our room was standard motel chain fake colonial with one wall painted blue. But is well maintained. Our room was under the stairwell, so dark (102). The walls are very thin and I think the windows are single pane since street noise and every sound of the room above can be heard. Add to that a malfunctioning air conditioning unit that made random boinging noises and it was not a restful night. On the other hand, it is a lot cheaper then some other properties in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: phathuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 114. Had people in room 214 above us walking around and the floor boards were extremely loose and noisy. Could hear every step they took. So book an upstairs room if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Horrified”
Reviews.Author: rcommittee
Reviews.Content: Well when I booked the room, the pictures were all very nice and welcoming. When we get there, it was another story. The room didn't smell clean at all and I was about to bring in my blanket ( I bring a blanket from home) and my friend said NO, that we needed to check the room out first. At first I didn't know what she meant, but then it hit me. She wanted to make sure there were no bed bugs. To my surprise, we ended up finding some and we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diveraddict
Reviews.Content: Very good motel, with above average accommodations. Very clean and comfortable, with large rooms and a good bathroom. They have no breakfast, but there is a coffee machine on the room and a Starbucks at walking distance. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: robatc
Reviews.Content: After searching online for a good 15-20 minutes without finding anything, we stumbled on the Chablis Inn which took pets for a reasonable fee and had availability. The rate was good, check-in smooth (with a doggie treat bag) and while the exterior clearly says 'motel' the room surprised us. Good bed, linens and updated bathroom (although the walls of the bathroom in this particular room were ready for some fresh paint and minor touch-up). The room itself was clean, freshly painted and perfect for our needs. While I would not call it our new favorite, it certainly served the purpose and worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Napa Valley every year, and always stay here. Rooms are large, clean and comfortable with no frills. With the money we save staying here, we're able to spend more on all the excellent restaurants and wines Napa has to offer. Its conveniently located right by the highway. While it doesn't have nice views or luxury, its all you need for the limited time you'll spend in your room. Also, there's a hot tub and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: SightseeMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. I thought I had lost some jewelry and they went above and beyond to look for it. I really appreciate the service they provided us.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly, But”
Reviews.Author: parkinsd
Reviews.Content: They forgot the soundproofing on the second floor. Because of our dog they gave us a first floor room. The couple above us, just walking to and fro, sounded like the Dance of the Elephants. They had to move us. The WiFi is spotty, except in the office. If you have a pet and the price is right then this place is merely OK.

Reviews.Title: “Best dog-friendly hotel in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Napadoglover
Reviews.Content: First, they only charge $10 for the pet. (It's $70--non-refundable at Marriott). They provide treats and a list of places where it's ok to take dogs, such as outdoor restaurants, which wineries are dog-friendly, where the dog parks are. The motel is located right next to a bike path, perfect for taking the dog on long walks. Napa's nicest grocery store (Vallerga's) is right nearby and has wonderful deli and take out foods. Staff couldn't be nicer. We had the dog and someone who had just had knee surgery. Staff very helpful with him too, gave us a room on the ground floor, accessible bathrooms, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Need someplace to lay your head in Napa - Sign up here”
Reviews.Author: AngeLaPeregrina
Reviews.Content: Okay. We stayed here because of the great prices. It is in Napa town - which by definition isn't the most splendid part of the region. However the motel is next to the highway and the drive to the wineries is short & sweet. The room was newly remodeled in a suburban townhouse style and was very clean. To be perfectly honest we didn't spend too much time in the motel - our plan was to see the countryside & just needed somewhere to sleep. Worked out perfectly. The front desk staff was so very nice and accomodating too. Napa isn't that fancy a place as it is and this motel is as good as any other I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: partho22
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Chablis Inn. The room was spacious and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room had a microwave and a refrigerator which was very handy. Towels were softer than any other comparable inn that we have stayed in. All in all, a great find for the price in the heart of Napa and we would definitely go there again. Being pet-friendly was a big plus since we were traveling with our two dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but..”
Reviews.Author: bigbucksnowhammies
Reviews.Content: This place is relatively cheap, but it kinda sucks....Rooms are extremely basic. There were no outward signs that it was unclean, but I didn't trust it. There are better places in the area for comparable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: leesahmarie
Reviews.Content: We searched for a hotel all through Napa Valley for months before we found The Chablis Inn. We chose it because of price, location, and positive reviews. We absolutely loved everything about our stay here. We stayed 4 nights, and everything was great. Office staff was very friendly, the room was wonderfully clean & comfy, the place was quiet even during the booked weekend, and the room had helpful amenities including a mini fridge, coffee pot, iron & board, and hairdryer. This hotel is in a great area, across the street from: a whole foods type grocery store with great pastries & dinner items, a pizza place, Starbucks, and Target is a very short walk away too. I'm not usually the type to write hotel reviews, but we had such a hard time finding a hotel in Napa, and had such a great experience with this hotel, that I thought it would help anyone else out there who is traveling to Napa on a budget like we were. This hotel is also right off the main highway that takes you to all the vineyards, so it's a great, safe, and quiet area. The office staff was also nice enough to let us choose our room when we arrived. This is a great & smart place to stay that is honestly a steal for Napa Valley!! This is a great choice for couples, singles, families, and pets too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SarnyCay
Reviews.Content: Got the info from the local Tourist Info in Napa. Rates were great due to last minute US$89+tax. Nice place, clean and the little kitchen was convenient. Easy access to highway, walmart is close and great starting point for driving through Napa/Sonoma Valley.

Reviews.Title: “$200/night and ants are acceptable in your room-- apparently”
Reviews.Author: Kristez
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for $200/night including tax. I had read the reviews on trip advisor and had hoped for a clean room. Instead, I got a room with ants. In fact, when I woke up in the morning I had ants in my clothes which were placed on the bathroom counter as well as the shower. I did my best to clean the ants and then promptly went to the staff at the counter to discuss my issue. She asked for my room number and then said matter of factly, "oh, yeah, room 14 has ants". No offer of discount or anything else. I then asked to speak to a manager and was told the manager was "on vacation" and she would have to see the room for herself to get a discount. I then had the staff person go into the hotel room to look at the number of ants and she returned saying, "I'm not going to credit your card for 1 ant". I explained minutes before I had them all over my clothes and if we gave them time they would return. She avoided eye contact with me and did not offer any other condolence. Needless to say, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: RandR916
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this motel and although it isn't in the center of the wineries, it was a good location to end at. We started at the northern end near Calistoga and worked our way down back to the Napa area. Staff was friendly and room was clean. For the price and location, this was a great find. If you are looking for a good motel at a decent price and prefer to spend your money elsewhere such as wine and food...this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jabrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while visiting Napa. Considering the prices of hotels in the area, we got this for a rock-bottom $105/night and the room was great for the price. It was clean and had a little kitchenette. The bathroom door didn't shut too well, but we weren't there long term. Slow wi-fi. Not the softest beds in the world, but decent. Great customer service - the lady at the desk printed driving directions for us and answered many questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: PretzelMontreal
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is located near highway but you don't ear anything. The room was super clean, the bed was really comfortable (have to say that we stayed there after a complete week in camping so we REALLY enjoyed this bed!!). The linen was sooooo comfortable! Our room has a kitchenette but since we were there only for 1 night, we didn't use it. However, it looked perfect. Some people were desapointed in the fact that vineyards were a bit far but since you are not able to visit vineyards without having a car, it's not a big deal!! Ask for a map at the front desk that shows all of them and where they are located.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room”
Reviews.Author: cheerymcc
Reviews.Content: We only had one night here on route elsewhere but it did the job. The room was huge and had a mini kitchen which we weren't expecting. We used the jacuzzi which was great after a days driving. It also has a small pool. It is quite a bit from downtown but taxis no problem. The supermarket across the road is fantastic! You even get free tea/coffee while you shop.

Reviews.Title: “basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: purplevicki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis Inn for 2 nights in a room with 2 double beds which were very large but slightly hard! The room was huge though and very clean. The hotel had a small pool and a nice jacuzzi which was nice to sit in after a day of activities. The location is fine, across the street from a small shopping plaza with a supermarket and a starbucks - fine for breakfast and other needs. You have to drive to downtown Napa but there are other eating places just across the freeway. Overall, a good location for exploring the Napa wine valley and a good price compared to others in the region.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Dog-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: SanFran_Lady
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Chablis Inn, July 2008. Our experience was GREAT. Check-in was friendly and efficient. Rates for Fri, Sat stay were expectedly higher than week night prices. The Room: We had an upstairs room furtherest from the street. Room was clean, quiet, completely functional. Refrigerator, Cable TV with limited channel access, wireless internet access in the room at no charge, jacuzzi tub, coffee maker, air conditioner (thank goodness since it was HOT) -- nothing fancy. One note: did have issues with the internet access, when it worked it was great, but most of the time was VERY slow. The Staff: Friendly, helpful, effiicent, and completely flexible. Great recommendations for dinner. The Grounds/Building: Very clean, pleasant, although the color scheme was a little bright, but fresh and well cared for. The pool and spa area was clean, very nice and in perfect working order. Great location. easy access to downtown Napa, freeways/roads to wine tasting. Across the street from a GREAT grocery store, and a Starbucks. Dog-friendly: Some places say pet friendly and barely tolerate you having your dog on the premises. These folks welcomed our dog, gave us a little care package full of treats. They have a nice area, albeit behind the building that is for your dog to do their "business." Clean covered with wood chips, with plenty of garbage cans. Located right off a bike path. In summary it was nothing fancy, but it was comfortable overall, perfect if your focus is wine tasting and not hanging out in the room. Would definitely stay here again, great price for a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Desk Clerk at the Chablis Inn”
Reviews.Author: dimes
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk was excellent. The room was very clean and comfy. The pool and hot tub were nice on the warm days and cool nights. We had a room with a kitchenette which was nice for leftovers. It was wonderful for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good would be a stretch”
Reviews.Author: orupaperboy
Reviews.Content: This was the hardest bed my wife and I have ever slept on! We're not picky, we just need a clean, safe, adequate room. The air conditioner was hard to use, and wasn't very cool. Everything else was fine, I just can't get over how hard the bed was!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysElegant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and well maintained. The only negative was that the traffic noise was louder than we expected. Even though our room was approximately 200 feet from the two-lane road, the car and truck traffic was strangely loud. It may be because we faced the road though. Not all of the rooms face the road and, if I were to stay there again, I'd ask for a room that didn't face the road. It is very convenient to Starbucks and right off of the highway coming and going to Yountville, St. Helena, etc. Its about 2 miles from Copia and the Oxbow Market so its very convenient for food/wine lovers. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I had to change my room type late in the day and they didn't get ruffled about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value- will stay at Chablis again”
Reviews.Author: BUZZAlison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis in 2006. I did NOT encounter any problems during my stay, about the same as last time. I've tried other hotels in the area. Some might be a shade bit better (I like the Best Western Elm House Inn, too) and there's some I will stay away from completely (SEE Napa Travelodge-UGH!). This one is fine for the money. Hotel manager was very friendly, too. I'll be back in Napa in March, so I might see if things changed. BTW, for the reviewer who was disappointed the hot tub was not in operation: Pretty normal for Northern California- during my stay, it was windy, cold and raining almost constantly, same as the time you happened to be visiting. Using an outdoor hot tub in this kind of weather isn't much fun anyway, so most hotels close the tubs in the winter season. The Chablis Inn is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodation in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Aloha800
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as a base for our foray into wine country. The Chablis Inn turned out to be pretty basic accomodations for the amount of money charged. There was even a increase in rate for a Thursday night, which I found odd. I was disappointed that the outdoor hot tub was closed for the winter - I thought they were usable year round? Our room had a jet tub, but we didn't use it. The room was clean, quiet (very few other guests at the time), and the bed was comfortable, but the rooms showed that they are in need of cosmetic repairs here and there. The remote control for the television was covered in tape, and there wasn't a lot of channels to choose from. The location was pretty good, right near a small strip mall with a grocery store (good for breakfast/coffee) and a few coffee shops. Too far to walk to downtown Napa though. They do accept dogs at the Inn so if you are travelling with your pet it would be a good option. If I was to return to the area, I would not stay here again, and see if I could get a better rate at one of the chain motels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Motel for the Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SandiToes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis Inn for a week in September. We highly recommend this motel for budget travelers looking for a simple, clean room. The motel is close to a nice grocery store and Starbucks (both across the street), a gas station, Trader Joe's, Target, a mexican restaurant, etc. It's a couple miles from downtown Napa and a great starting point for exploring Napa and Sonoma counties. Our room had a refrigerator, stove, and microwave and was always very clean. I even found the bed to be comfortable! We were very pleasantly surprised with this motel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nicely remodeled, older motel.”
Reviews.Author: caleggs
Reviews.Content: Very clean king room w/ jacuzzi tub. The color scheme was very soothing and loved the crown molding. We enjoyed 2 wonderful, comfortable nights here in the height of tourist season. The only complaints would be the pool and pool area. The pool was freezing in the late afternoon/evening, even though the days were near 100 degrees....and there was no lighting. My husband & I like to play cards & sip our wine by the pool at night, and we could barely see the cards. Other than that, it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Napa in the summer”
Reviews.Author: Sunall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chablis Inn July 27 & 28, 2007 - rented 3 rooms - girls trip to Napa. It is easy to locate off of Highway, clean, quiet, pool area is small but clean & fine for a quick dip to cool off. We would stay here again - very reasonable price for Napa on a weekend in July.

Reviews.Title: “What the Inn lacked the front desk made up for....”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel_socal
Reviews.Content: When we reached the street where the hotel was located, we were greeted with a large Target sign to our great dismay. (This is Napa, right?) Apprehensively we turned into the Inn, a red, two-story buiding, again, not quite Napa. Upon check in we met John who was outstanding! He answered all of our questions and made great suggestions including the wine tour company to call. It was 5pm, the day before we wanted to go on the tour and they were booked. John called up to make sure we were settling in ok and I told him about the tour. He said he would call back. Sure enough, he found one for us and got us booked for the next day! The room was average, but clean and the price was very reasonable. It's not too far from downtown. We took a taxi that cost $8 one way. Though the hotel didn't have the charm of many of the B & B's, it also didn't have the price. It was a perfect choice for what we wanted...spend less on the room and more on the wine!

Reviews.Title: “great stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: haringdr27
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, very clean, great location, supermarket and gas station across the street. Internet in the lobby, nice pool and hot tub.Location was right off the highway and great starting point for the wineries. I loved the stay and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: biggerfoot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights in early June. Not fancy but clean and great value for the area. Free internet terminal in office for customer use.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: rapjenn
Reviews.Content: We lucked out by paying a discounted rate through the Entertainment Book. I believe the rate is usually about 150/night for a queen (we got it for around 80). The room was nice. It was clean, it had a fridge, tub/shower, a sink and mirror outside the bathroom, and all the other "normal" room furnishings. If you are in Napa to enjoy the wine and not going to be in your hotel a whole lot, this is a decent place to stay. No breakfast provided though. Our friends also stayed at the hotel in the room next door. Their only complaint was thin walls. They got to hear more then wanted from their neighbors to the other side and upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: splicha
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Napa for less than $100 is tough and requires lowering your expectations a little. But my stay at the Chablis Inn had some serious drawbacks. The room was clean and quiet but had a big stain on the carpet. The wall heater and AC unit did not work, just the fan did, and it gets pretty cold at night. The biggest problem was the terrible shower. The water pressure was so bad that I was pressed up against the wall with the spigot just so it would hit me. Truly an awful shower. I would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Motel”
Reviews.Author: MazNYC
Reviews.Content: We needed a place right in the middle of Napa, Sonoma and Calistoga. This was a good location. The price was not bad at about $100/night. It is right by Highway 29 which leads you into Napa. The location is good. You are about 15 minutes at the most from Calistoga and about 20 minutes from Sonoma. We stayed 3 nights. There was always clean towels and coffee for us each morning. No funky smells or things crawling around. The bathroom was clean. There was even a sink outside which made it easy when the bathroom is in use. Couple blocks away are some small shopping areas and places to eat. There is a Sizzler and Applebee's not too far. We were there to do wine tasting so we didn't spend too much time at the motel. That was our priority. If you are looking for a cute place and plan to spend time there...then this is not the place for you. If you have an adgenda then this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget motel”
Reviews.Author: tigercage
Reviews.Content: The king room we stayed in for three nights proved quite satisfactory. The room is small, about 300 sq ft, clean, furnishings and fabrics in good condition, for about $100 per night (mid week). The photos in their web sight were accurate in every detail. We have paid more and recieved less in Napa. The room was not sound proof so noisy neighbors could be a problem. The office staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: GreCh
Reviews.Content: Touring through Sonoma & Napa & looked for a room a the last minute. The Napa visitor center gave us a list of available accomadations. Chablis right off Hwy, easy to get too. Very surpized on the quality of the room. The outside is deceiving. Bed was very comfortable, whirlpool tub just what I needed that night. Great Value. Would recommend to anyone looking for a quality room & doesn't mind not having other hotel ammenties(resturant, club, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: TrishC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chablis Inn for one night in late June 2006 after staying one night right next door at the Redwood Inn. It was quite a surprise. From the outside it looks like any other budget hotel that you see, yet the rooms were surprisingly nicely fitted out and very clean. The hotel was quietier than expected as it is next to the I29 and in a great location, close to everything and right across the road from a new small shopping mall and supermarket where you can buy everything that you need for a day winetasting. I cannot recommend this hotel high enough. It was all you need when you are travelling and trying to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Accomodations in Napa”
Reviews.Author: thonnyboy
Reviews.Content: The Chablis Inn is a small motel off of Highway 29 in Napa, California. It is not particularly memorable, romantic or fancy inside but, that being said, it was clean and comfortable for one night. I have attached pictures of what our room looked like upon check in so that you can see for yourself. It has a small pool and hot tub that were fine and there is a grocery store across the street if you need to pick up any items during your travels. It is next door to the Napa Valley Redwood Inn and down the street from the Marriott. If you are looking for a romantic bed and breakfast in Napa or a hotel with lots of amenities, I would absolutely look elsewhere. If you are looking for budget accomodations for one or two nights in the Napa Valley area, the Chablis Inn is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Highlander95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an affordable motel since we had a long trip planned down the California coast. The Chablis Inn is very simple, but comfortable. I had no problems with reservations and check in was simple. Our room had the king size bed and it was a little harder than I'm used to, but felt really good after a long day of tastings! The whirlpool and pool were very clean and well-maintained. Be sure to check with the front desk on complimentary or 2-for-1 tasting coupons that they have for some local wineries. The motel is located right off 29 and is near The Prime Outlets and a Target. Its a short drive to COPIA/downtown Napa. I would definitely stay at the motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithDoggie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chablis at the last minute and was not certain what to expect. What I found was nice service, a decent room, nice in size with a nice pool area. The hotel had nice little touches (a welcome bag for my dog, great bath products, good tourist guides) all at a very reasonable price considering the area where a decent place generally goes for twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: brolls286
Reviews.Content: If you're trying to stay on a budget in pricey Napa and planning to spend less than $100/night for a hotel, you'll find there aren't many places to choose from that are still in a convenient location. Chablis Inn was a great value for the money and was in a good location- but keep in mind this is an expensive area. You're not going to be staying at a Hilton-type hotel for less than $100. Chablis looks a little drab from the outside, but the rooms were suprisingly nice. The rooms were very clean, well-kept and pretty spacious, the bathroom water pressure/temperature/availability of towels was great, the staff was very nice and helpful. The pool was closed when we were there (due to the 6 weeks of rain the Bay Area was being flooded with at the time), but it looked very basic- concrete patio and privacy fence around it. My strategy for this trip to Napa was to spend my money at the wineries/shopping, not to drop big bucks on accomodations; Chablis worked perfectly. The beautiful scenery and fabulous wine/food was what I wanted (and got!). Chablis Inn was a fantastic value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel- good Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: SusanSwartz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 nights in this motel. I was very nervous because it was an impromptu trip during a prime season, and I could not find anywhere to stay but the Chablis. Needless to say, I was worried about the quality of this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. I expected it to be a dump. It is not fabulous by any means, but for basically a motel, it was higher quality than most. The rooms are very clean. The bed was as as comfortable as our Palace hotel room in San Francisco. Our room had a king bed, a jacuzzi tub, and I mini fridge that came in handy in storing our wine when we had some left over. We sat in the hot tub outside and enjoyed some wine. Compared to the price of other lodgings in the area, I thought it was a good value. My only complaint was that the window unit was a little noisy, but so are most of them and it didn't bother my husband a bit. If you don't want to spend more that $125 per night, it is a good choice. If money is no object and you want romantic, it is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small Motel was WAY over priced for what you get. But, compared to the rest of Napa I guess it was a deal at $159. We stayed here one evening in August and slept. Tthat was it. The room was very plain but a decent size. The front desk person was very blah. Not friendly but not rude either. Just kinda there. Would I stay here again - I hope not.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable lodging”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantPeninsulan
Reviews.Content: As you can gather from the other reviews, the Chablis Inn is a tarted-up old motel. It looks pleasant enough both inside and out. The redecoration works, the linens are nice, and it's clear more has been done to it than just throw a couple of cans of paint on the walls. The location is prime, and the surroundings are quiet. Two problems keep this motel from getting 5 stars. First, I have to knock off 1 star for noise from the surrounding rooms. The achilles' heel of this hotel is the motel-style door to the adjoining room. Even though you'll keep this closed and locked (unless you have kids in the next room), any noise in the next room blasts right through that door. People don't even have to be loud in order to be heard in the next room. This is quite annoying at 3 am. Second, I have to knock off one more star for the bizarre reservation system. You reserve a room like any other hotel - giving your credit card number to reserve the room, either by phone or via the web. Nevertheless, the motel will call you a couple of days before your visit and _require_ you to call back to confirm; if you don't, they'll sell your room out from under you. Be very careful if you're staying here as part of a long vacation and you're not going to be able to check (or you'll forget to check) your phone messages - you may find a nasty surprise waiting for you when you arrive. And rooms in Napa can be very difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Average place with nice pool”
Reviews.Author: stsang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right by Hwy 29 where most of the wineries are located - but its not the quaintest hotel. Its sufficient if you're not spending too much time in your room. The staff were unhelpful. Didn't know where the nearest public tennis courts are (we found great courts on Linda Vista Drive) and didn't offer any advices for dinner (there are a couple of nice Italian restaurants in Napa downtown). We got most of our information from Napa Tourist Office. The Inn was the most expensive place we stayed in during our entire time in California with the least amenitities. Not the best value but the cheapest cleanest place probably in Napa Valley with a good pool and hot tub and a fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in overpriced Napa!”
Reviews.Author: romarosie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find a comfortable room that wouldn't break my pocketbook in Napa during a visit. Since I was traveling for business, I didn't need a "romantic getaway" style room. Most hotel rooms in Napa run around $150-300 a night. However, the wonderful wine sellers at Folie au Deux suggested I try the Chablis Inn because their rates are $104 for a Queen room and $109 for a King sized bed room. Upon arrival, you notice the hot tub (big enough for 4 people) and the bean shaped pool in a private garden terrace next to the office. The staff was so friendly and made dinner suggestions within walking distance of the hotel. I went with the King and was so glad I did. The rooms come with a coffee pot, small kitchen area with a sink and cupboards, a full sized ironing board, a huge bathroom with big, fluffy towels, a desk with ample outlet space to charge up a laptop and cell phone. The room had a large screen TV with HBO and cable. The room was clean, comfortable and very nicely decorated. I would say the hotel was renovated within the last year or so. And they have lots parking for your vehicle. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is visiting Napa. It's located directly off of Route 29 just past the town of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In spite of its cheesy name, I had a great experience at the Chablis Inn. I stayed one night in a deluxe king room, and was impressed by the quality of the room considering that it looked like nothing special from the outside. The difference between the superior king and the deluxe king is really just that the deluxe has a whirlpool tub and a duvet instead of a bedspread. The whirlpool tub was nice, but like another reviewer experienced, there were some black flakes that came out of the jets the first time i ran the bath. I think that was just a sign that they hadn't been used in a while, I don't know. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very clean. The location is good, off Highway 29 between downtown Napa and the beginning of the stretch of wineries. All together a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “great value place”
Reviews.Author: yoslug
Reviews.Content: We were newly married & stayed here for 2 nights (read: we were on a budget) and got that & more. The room was very clean, there was a continental breakfast (the basics, but that was all we needed) there was a refrigerator in the room as well as a hot tub outdoors which was wonderful in the cool night air. Also, there was a grocery store right across the street (take out food, wine, etc.) The location is great - you are close to everything. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Chablis Inn- decent place”
Reviews.Author: Geoggirl
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with friends who had a dog so Chablis Inn was were we stayed. The rooms were decent. We were looking forward to the jacuzzi tub but were a little grossed out because the jets would shoot out black gunk occassionally. It was not walking distance to much,
